benchmark_details.name: JETTS (Judge Evaluation for Test-Time Scaling)
benchmark_details.overview: The JETTS benchmark evaluates judge performance in three domains (math reasoning, code generation, and instruction following) under three task settings: response reranking, step-level beam search, and critique-based response refinement.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of LLM-judges in test-time scaling scenarios.

data.source: Responses generated from multiple large language models trained for different tasks.
data.annotation: Responses were generated automatically without manual annotation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on judge performance across various tasks and datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Positive normalized helpfulness means the judge aids in improving the model generation.
methodology.baseline_results: Responses are compared against greedy decoding performance and random selection.
methodology.validation: Performance is validated through comparisons with existing models and evaluations.
